reasoning: Umbrella term covering both benign skin tumors (seborrheic keratosis, nevi, lipomas) and malignant neoplasms (melanoma, basal cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma). Aggregate BOTEC estimate summing major categories: melanoma (~20 per 100k), non-melanoma skin cancers (~100-150 per 100k globally), benign nevi and other benign tumors (~100-150 per 100k). Total ~300 per 100k. Low confidence due to high heterogeneity between benign and malignant categories and significant geographic variation.
